task.title: Install Plant Applications Universal Client Docker on Linux

prereq.p: Before you begin the installation of the Plant Applications Universal Client Docker on the Windows system, ensure that:

ul.li: You are an Administrator with execute permissions.
Your system meets the preinstallation requirements.
Download the installation package from the Artifactory and extract the package to your preferred location.
Complete the steps from 1 to 14 in the Install the Plant Application Docker on Windows topic as an Administrator.
Access the .YML file and make it up and running.
Change the file permission to 777 wherever required.

step.cmd: After you extracted the installer package and specified the required credentials, select Export in the You are ready to install screen.
step.stepresult: A message appears that the export is successful.

step.cmd: Copy the exported folders (plantapps-web-docker, plantapps-universal-client, pa-dtr, and pa-services-tars) and go to the location where you want to run these Docker files.
In the pa-dtr folder, access the dtrRun.sh file and run the Shell script as an Administrator after changing the file permission to 777. This is necessary to create the docker registry.

info.note: If you already have a docker registry, skip the steps 3 and 4.

step.cmd: Go to the following locations to check if the docker registry is created successfully.

ul.li: Registry-url: http://<machineip>:5000 for checking if the registry is up and running.
Registry-web-url: http://<machineip>:8080 for checking the docker images.

step.cmd: Using terminal, navigate to the pa-services-tars folder and run docker-push-util.sh <machineip>:<your_port>.

info.note: Ensure that you have added your <machine IP>: <port> to the Daemon wizard and <machine IP> to the Proxies wizard in the Docker Settings.

step.cmd: In the plantapps-web-docker folder, open the .env file.
Replace the values in the following PATH records with the Installation directory location of the Linux system. This is necessary to run the Plant Applications services.
In the plantapps-web-docker > Scripts folder, access the workorder_entrypoint.sh file.
Replace the value in red with the installation directory location of the Linux system.
In the plantapps-web-docker folder, run the PA_Services_Start_Lix.sh file.
In the plantapps-universal-client folder, open the .env file.
step.stepresult: The records associated with the PATH and FILE keys appear.

step.cmd: Replace the values in the following PATH records with the Installation directory location of the Linux system. This is necessary to enable the Plant Applications Apphub.
In the plantapps-universal-client folder, run the PA_Apps_Start_Lix.sh file.

taskbody.result: The Plant Applications Universal Client Docker is installed on the Linux system. Wait for a few minutes to access the Plant Applications.
